interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2012/07/22 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tim Gibbons', 'Genéa Gaudet', 'Adam Hirsch'], 'Producers': ['Tim Gibbons', 'Christopher Poole', 'Bill Hayes', 'Jen Stocks', 'Kirk Streb', 'Mary Wilcher', 'Maggie Kay', 'Deanie Wilcher'], 'Studio': ['TLC']} Review Text: After watching all the seasons of Sisterwives, I feel I have come to love them and all that they stand for. I am "mainstream" LDS. It is against our beliefs to live this type of life because it is against the law. BUT, I have such respect for the Brown family and all that they stand for. They are true to the faith. I could never condemn or otherwise harrass these beautiful people. I believe in religious freedom and think the government needs to stay out of these peoples lives. They have wonderful relationships though they do have dissagreements as would any family. Those children are soooo loved and they know it. Cody is a great Dad and husband and if only more men were like him, what a better world this would be. Each and every one of these wives are amazing, kind and loving individuals. They just want peace for their family. God bless you Brown family and hang in there. I believe there will come a time when you will be allowed to practice your religion with no fear.

I relate your situation to the persecution of the first LDS people in the early days of the restoration of the gospel. I would love to meet you one day as I'm sure I would grow as a person, just from being in the presence of each and everyone of your delightful spirits. Hugs and love from an LDS woman. Review Title: Amazing way of life....in a good way Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Religious Values:** The user identifies as "mainstream" LDS and expresses a strong belief in religious freedom. They advocate for the separation of church and state and respect for diverse lifestyles, reflecting an open-minded approach to differing beliefs.

- **Empathy & Support:** They demonstrate a compassionate attitude towards families with different beliefs, particularly the Brown family, highlighting admiration for their relationships and individual characteristics. 

- **Family Dynamics:** The user values strong family bonds and nurturing parental roles, as demonstrated by their appreciation for the father figure and the loving nature of the family.

- **Cultural Awareness:** They draw parallels between contemporary experiences and historical persecutions faced by LDS communities, indicating a deeper understanding of their faith’s history and its challenges.

- **Desire for Connection:** The user expresses a yearning for personal growth through interaction with others, specifically those of differing lifestyles, signifying an inclination toward community and shared experiences.

- **Positive Outlook:** Their language reflects an optimistic perspective on life and relationships, often wishing well for others and expressing a hopeful view of the future regarding religious freedom.

Overall, the user embodies a compassionate, understanding, and open mindset towards diverse family structures and religious practices, rooted in strong personal values and a desire for connection.
